frameDefinitions: An Agent causes a Patient to be more strong, often resulting in something that is more secure and safe.
An Agent, Situation or Entity has an influence on a Cognizer.
Two individuals, the Subordinate and the Superior have a relationship such that the Subordinate generally follows orders given by the Superior and has the best interests of the Superior in mind.
An Agent, by virtue of strength or forcefulness, controls, rules, or strongly influences some Patient in some Situation.
An Agent acts so as to be the strongest force, or most important causal factor in some Situation, to the exclusion of other competing actors.
These are words referring to control by a Leader over a particular entity  or group (the Governed) or an Activity.
frameExamples: Local Serbs are <t>strengthening</t> their grip on a narrow corridor along the Sava River between two large Serbian areas.
These works had a profound effect and <t>influenced</t> her in the creation of a successful series capturing this sun-drenched region.
The archduke and several of his <t><fex name='Subordinate'>henchmen</fex></t> got out of the carriage, looking around nervously.
The fireballing righthander looked poised to <t>dominate</t> the Yankees yet again, striking out seven straight batters during one stretch
York <t>dominated</t> the game as they held the ball on offense almost the entire 70 minutes.
Sebek em hat was a <t>Leader</t> of Priests. ca. 1780 BC
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Agent</fen> fortifies the <fen>Patient</fen>.
The <fen>Patient</fen> is the entity that is being made stronger.
An event which causes the <fen>Patient</fen> to become stronger.
The time at which the <fen>Agent</fen> makes the <fen>Patient</fen> stronger.
The location at which the <fen>Agent</fen> fortifies the <fen>Patient</fen>.
The person who is influenced by the <fen>Situation</fen> or <fen>Entity</fen>.
A state of affairs--- which can be an event, state or conditions---that has an influence on the <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
A person or thing that has an influence on the <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
An Action that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> decides to carry out as a consequence of the influence of a <fen>Situation</fen> or <fen>Entity</fen>.
A <fen>Behavior</fen> that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is engaged in independently but whose execution is subsequently influenced by the <fen>Situation</fen> or <fen>Entity</fen>.
An entity that stands metonymically for the actions and considerations that produced it.
The <fen>Agent</fen> acts to influence a <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the Subjective_influencing event occurs.
The location in which one has influence.
The individual in charge of the <fen>Subordinate</fen>.
The individual under the command of the <fen>Superior</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> controls the Patient by being forceful and possibly aggressive.
The <fen>Patient</fen> is trying to gain control of a situation, but ends up being subject to the control and influence of the <fen>Agent</fen>.
The time when the domination takes place.
The place where the domination occurs.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the most forceful and pivotal factor in the situation.
The <fen>Situation</fen> is primarily affected by the <fen>Agent</fen>, in particular how it develops or concludes.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> is dominant.
The location where the domination takes place.

The <fen>Leader</fen> is the one who has the role of leading.  With verbs, and with predicate nominals linking an individual to a <fen>Role</fen>, the <fen>Leader</fen> is usually the External Argument:

The role played by the <fen>Leader</fen> in a given situation, often an official title; incorporated in most noun LUsin this frame. When expressed separately from the target, <fen>Role</fen> usually occurs in a PP Complement headed by <ment>as</ment>.
The entity whose actions or beliefs the <fen>Leader</fen> directs in the context of a joint activity or movement.  This entity can be a political body, a person, or a group of people.
The <fen>Leader</fen> directs the <fen>Activity</fen>.
<fen>Time</fen> refers to the point in time that the leadership took place.
The locale from which the <fen>Leader</fen> leads the <fen>Governed</fen> or the <fen>Activity</fen>.
listRoleExamples: George Gilder would run with this idea later in writing the New Testament of supply-side economics that influenced <fex>Reagan</fex>.
<fex>The balmy temperatures</fex> inspired me to write a poem on the advent of spring.
<fex>The painting</fex> inspired me to take a risk and use the intense green for the sky.
What factors influenced Nixon <fex>to issue the doctrine</fex>?
Attention will also be paid to St. Paul , what influenced him <fex>in his thinking</fex> and what he wrote in his letters about sex, sexuality, men and women
Does anyone know what inspired <fex>this song</fex>?
Chavez has much influence <fex>in South America</fex>.
Their role models might have dominated women <fex>in the past</fex>; they may not have understood the concept of equality.
Women tend to dominatemen <fex>at home and at Church</fex>.
As discussed above, Ford dominated the market <fex>in the 1920s</fex>, then left the business to create production capacity for the Model A.
Indeed, <fex>in all Latin America</fex>, United States corporations dominated the key sectors of the economy.
The general led his troops into battle <fex>on June 22, 1883</fex>.
He ruled the west <fex>from his palace in Milan</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Philosophie de l'ornement : D'Orient en Occident11
Les conséquences culturelle de la globalisation
